instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Battery issue
threads.message:
Hi all, firstly Happy New Year to you all.
Secondly, I have this ongoing problem with an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Unless an orginal battery ( factory fitted) is put into this MBP, it fails to charge any other battery I put in. I have used 6 batteries from different suppliers and none will charge. But as soon as I fit and original battery charges and works fine.
Question is, has anybody swapped the board on an orginal battery to the cells from a " Genuine OEM" battery? Battery count is not an issue where as the power life span is.
Any one attempted this or is able to point me in the direction of a supplier of an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery that is as close to an original as can be.
Many thanks.
Marc

threads.title: Battery issue
threads.message: I am assuming that no replies means that no one has tried this or that it will not work?

threads.title: Battery issue
threads.message:
Battery pack has a processor and its dedicated memory.
If you disconnect a cell, need to reset the processor...
